sen.j: 花山院 師賢（かざんいん もろかた、正安3年（1301年）- 正慶元年/元弘2年（1332年）10月）は、鎌倉時代後期の公家。
sen.e: Morokata KAZANIN (1301 - 正慶元年/元弘2年(1332年)10月October or November 1332) was a court noble, who lived during the late Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 正慶元年/元弘2年（1332年）10月→October or November 1332としました。（正慶元年/元弘2年10月1日は、西暦 （グレゴリオ暦）1332年10月28日にあたるので、1332年11月の可能性もあります。）
sen.e: Morokata KAZANIN (1301 - October 1332) was a Court noble who lived during the late Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 正慶元年/元弘2年（1332年）10月→October 1332（新暦に換算すると、10月1日は10月28日になるので、October 1332としました。）
sen.e: Morokata KAZANIN (1301 - October 1332) was a Court noble who lived during the late Kamakura period.
His father was Moronobu KAZANIN.
His father was Moronobu KAZANIN.
His father was Moronobu KAZANIN.
His mother was FUJIWARA no Tadatsugu's granddaughter.
His mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Tadatsugu.
sen.cmt: 「藤原忠継」の英名が長いので、変更しました。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Tadatsugu.
His shingo (posthumous title) was Fumisadako (Lord Fumisada).
His posthumous name was Fumisadako (Lord Fumisada).
sen.cmt: 諡号→a posthumous name(Lord Fumisada)の前のスペースを1つ削除しました。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Fumisadako (Lord Fumisada).

sen.j: 持明院統の花園天皇に仕え、参議、左大弁、権中納言に至り、後醍醐天皇の代には中宮権大夫、左衛門督を歴任して正二位大納言に至った。
sen.e: He served Emperor Hanazono of Jimyoin-to lineage, and held the positions of Sangi (councilor), Sadaiben (controller of the Left), Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state), and during the reign of Emperor Godaigo, he consecutively held the posts of Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household), Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards), and finally he was ascended to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

Morokata who served the Emperor Hanazono of Jimyoin-to lineage, and held the offices of Sangi (councilor), Sadaiben (controller of the Left) and Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) held various posts such as Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household) and Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) during the reign of the Emperor Godaigo, and finally promoted to Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Major Counselor).
sen.cmt: 歴任する→hold various posts正二位大納言→Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Major Counselor)
sen.e: Morokata who served the Emperor Hanazono of Jimyoin-to lineage, and held the offices of Sangi (councilor), Sadaiben (controller of the Left) and Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) held various posts such as Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household) and Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) during the reign of the Emperor Godaigo, and finally promoted to Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Major Counselor).

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の北条高時が後醍醐天皇を配流しようとしたときには、天皇の身代わりとして御輿に乗り比叡山に入って北条方の目をくらまし、後醍醐天皇が笠置に遷幸するための時間稼ぎを行っている。
sen.e: When Takatoki HOJO of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) tried to exile the Emperor Godaigo, he bought the Emperor Godaigo some time to escape to Kasagi (Yamashiro Province) by entering Mt. Hiei with a palanquin which he rode on in place of the Emperor in order to cheat the Hojo side.

When Takatoki HOJO of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) tried to banish the Emperor Godaigo, Morokata bought the Emperor Godaigo some time to escape to Kasagi (Yamashiro Province) by entering Mt. Hiei with a palanquin which he rode on in place of the Emperor in order to cheat the Hojo side.
sen.cmt: 配流する→banish「御輿に乗り比叡山に入って」の英訳が不正確でしたので、変更しました。
sen.e: When Takatoki HOJO of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) tried to banish the Emperor Godaigo, Morokata bought the Emperor Godaigo some time to escape to Kasagi (Yamashiro Province) by entering Mt. Hiei with a palanquin which he rode on in place of the Emperor in order to cheat the Hojo side.

sen.j: その後、師賢も笠置に移ったが捕らえられて出家した。
sen.e: Afterwards, Morokata also move to Kasagi, but he was caught and he went into priesthood.
Although Morokata also moved to Kasagi thereafter, he was caught and went into priesthood.
sen.cmt: （移った）が、→Although（"although"で始まる文章に変更しました。）
sen.e: Although Morokata also moved to Kasagi thereafter, he was caught and went into priesthood.

sen.j: 1332年には下総国守護千葉貞胤に預けられ、同年その地で没した。
sen.e: In 1332, he was put under the custody of Shugo (the military governor) of Shimousa Province Sadatane CHIBA, and the next year, he died there.
In 1332, he was put under charge of Sadatane CHIBA, Shugo (the military governor) of Shimousa Province, and died there in the same year.
sen.cmt: ～に預けられる→put under charge of ～同年→in the same year（誤記を訂正しました。）
sen.e: In 1332, he was put under charge of Sadatane CHIBA, Shugo (the military governor) of Shimousa Province, and died there in the same year.
